p: In the continental United States, the states of Florida and Texas are emerging hotspots for Aedes aegypti-driven virus transmission. The Texas-Mexico border region has experienced local epidemics of dengue virus (DENV) in multiple communities [ 1â€“ 4]. In 2015, local transmission of chikungunya virus (CHIKV) occurred in Brownsville, TX, and 10 cases of Zika virus (ZIKV) were documented in South Texas by the Texas Department of State Health Services between 2016 and 2017 [ 5, 6].
